programme.title: India’s growing breaking scene makes room for B-Girls | Breaking Life
programme.desc: India’s Breaking scene started in the early 2000’s and has since exploded in popularity. While mostly male dominated, women are increasingly accepted and celebrated in the Indian Breaking scene. We meet B-Girl Jo, the two-time BC One India champion from Bangalore, as she travels alone to Mumbai. There, she meets her friend Flying Machine who organizes a community celebration event where B-Girls have a chance to battle it out. As a leader for Indian female hip-hop dancers, Jo reflects on her position in the society. With her own hip-hop and yoga studio and inspired by the challenges she’s already had to overcome, she examines her journey with both excitement and wisdom.

programme.title: Dakar breakers see new opportunities with Olympic debut| Breaking Life
programme.desc: With a classical and traditional African dance background, B-Boy Zaza is a key member of Power Crew, one of the most successful crew in Senegal. Joined by his young brother Emma, their crew is more like a family and made them travel to major global events. Now a teacher, tasked with navigating the challenges of his community, the dance gives him hope for a brighter future. With Paris 2024 and Dakar Youth Olympic Games in 2026, the elders and next generation alike to build their own future and for the sport as it takes roots in Senegal. Organized by the local dance federation, they participate in the Battle National, featuring some of Senegal’s best emerging talents.

programme.title: Shooting | Olympic Qualifier | Women's 10m Air Rifle Final | World Cup Rifle/Pistol | Baku
programme.desc: Watch the women's 10m air rifle final from the Olympic Qualifier and ISSF Shooting World Cup Rifle/Pistol in Baku, Azerbaijan.

programme.title: Shooting vs Cricket with Manu Bhaker and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: What happens in the battle of precision between cricket and shooting? The challenge is on, as Smriti Mandhana and Manu Bhaker swap the pistols and bats.

programme.title: Sports Swap: Boxing vs Shooting with Joe Joyce & Amber Hill
programme.desc: Can Olympic boxing silver medallist Joe Joyce hit any clays trying skeet shooting for the first time?

programme.title: Weightlifting | Olympic Qualifier | Day 3 | Grand Prix I | Havana
programme.desc: Watch the women's 55kg and men's 61kg Group A Weightlifting competitions and join us for the Olympic Qualifier and IWF Grand Prix I in Havana, Cuba.

programme.title: Boxing vs weightlifting with Shimizu Satoshi & Takao Hiroaki | Sports Swap Japan
programme.desc: Can Olympic boxing bronze medallist snatch 40 kg on his first attempt?

programme.title: Sports Swap: Diving vs Weighlifting with Lü Xiaojun & CHEN Aisen
programme.desc: What happens when a World Champion Weightlifter tries to dive? How strong is the world's best diver?

programme.title: Opening Ceremony | Barcelona 1992 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive the greatest Olympic Moments and watch Barcelona's Opening Ceremony for the Barcelona Summer Olympic Games in 1992

programme.title: Foul Play: APART
programme.desc: During apartheid, a promising sprinter named Odessa Swarts was unable to compete internationally. Now, her son is an Olympic champion.

programme.title: United States’ Michael Johnson (extended)
programme.desc: History-making Olympic champion Michael Johnson continues to connect with the next generation and loves making a difference

programme.title: Russia’s Aleksandr Karelin (extended)
programme.desc: Three-time Olympic champion Aleksandr Karelin now has the Kremlin as the ultimate goal, having swapped the sporting arena for politics

programme.title: Opening Ceremony | Athens 2004 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Watch the spectacular Opening Ceremony of the Athens Summer Olympic Games in 2004 once more and remember the greatest moments

programme.title: France’s Didier Dinart (extended)
programme.desc: Follow the two-time Olympic gold medallist handball player as he returns to his home island of Guadeloupe to see his lasting legacy.

programme.title: Opening Ceremony | Beijing 2008 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Remember the greatest moments from the Opening Ceremony of the Beijing Summer Olympic Games in 2008 and watch it once more

programme.title: Germany’s Matthias Steiner (extended)
programme.desc: Watch the extended version of the Legends Live On episode featuring German weightlifter Matthias Steiner, who won an inspiring gold medal at the Beijing 2008 Olympic Games shortly after the unexpected death of his wife. As a major figure and best-selling author in Germany, he is now inspiring future generations to lead healthier lives.

programme.title: Men's Road Race | Rio 2016 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Greg van Avermaet wins the Gold for Belgium, Jakob Fuglsang the Silver for Denmark and Rafal Majka the Bronze for Poland in the men's cycling road race at the Rio Summer Olympic Games in 2016

programme.title: Kenyan cycle legends in the making
programme.desc: "We can't just put a runner on a bike." How Kenya's cycle teams are trying to emulate the nation's sporting heroes.

programme.title: Yousef Mirza: Olympic legacy target for UAE's top cyclist
programme.desc: The UAE's best cyclist Yousif Mirza has a vital role in helping his country on the road to making a sporting impact at international level.

programme.title: Women's Individual Epee Final | Rio 2016 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Emese Szasz wins the Gold for Hungary and Rossella Fiamingo the Silver for Italy in the women's individual epee final at the Rio Summer Olympic Games in 2016

programme.title: Fencing's never-ending second
programme.desc: The fencing piste is not normally a setting for controversy, but that all changed at London 2012 when Britta Heidemann took on Shin A-Lam.

programme.title: Men's Judo -60kg Final | Athens 2004 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Tadahiro Nomura wins gold for Japan in the men's judo extra-lightweight final and Nestor Khergiani claims silver for Georgia at the Athens Summer Olympic Games in 2004

programme.title: Women's Judo -48kg Final | Athens 2004 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Ryoko Tani wins gold for Japan in the women's judo extra-lightweight final and Frédérique Jossinet claims silver for France at the Athens Summer Olympic Games in 2004

programme.title: How Japan came to be a land of judo legends
programme.desc: Japanese judo legends and Youth Olympic stars demystify the "secret sauce" behind the beauty of perfecting judo the Japanese way.

programme.title: Women's Taekwondo -49kg Final | Sydney 2000 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Lauren Burns wins the Gold for Australia and Urbia Melendez the Silver for Cuba in the women's flyweight taekwondo final at the Sydney Summer Olympic Games in 2000

programme.title: How taekwondo helped this Iranian refugee start a new life
programme.desc: Raheleh Asemani was always a standout athlete, but after leaving Iran for Belgium as a political refugee sport helped her start afresh

programme.title: Men's Individual Sabre Final | London 2012 | Great Olympic Moments
programme.desc: Relive the greatest Olympic Moments from the London Summer Olympic Games in 2012 and watch as Áron Szilágyi wins gold for Hungary in the men's individual sabre final, and Diego Occhiuzzi wins silver for Italy

programme.title: Past and Present - Fencing
programme.desc: We challenged fourth generations of fencing equipment manufacturers to test how their sporting garments has evolved.
